EnhancedContent:
Gemini 3.1 Pro, Google’s latest agentic coding model, is now rolling out in GitHub Copilot. In early testing, this model excels on effective and efficient edit-then-test loops with high tool precision, achieving strong resolution success with fewer tool calls per benchmark.

[https://github.blog/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/gemini31-pro-demo-1.mp4#t=0.001](https://github.blog/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/gemini31-pro-demo-1.mp4#t=0.001)

### Availability in GitHub Copilot

Gemini 3.1 Pro will be available to [Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise](https://github.com/features/copilot/plans?utm_source=changelog-codex53-cta&utm_medium=changelog&utm_campaign=newmodels) users.

You’ll be able to select the model in the model picker in:

- Visual Studio Code in all modes: chat, ask, edit, agent
- Visual Studio in all modes: agent, ask
- github.com
- GitHub Mobile iOS and Android

Rollout will be gradual. Check back soon if you don’t see it yet.

### Enabling access

Copilot Enterprise and Copilot Business plan administrators must enable the Gemini 3.1 Pro policy in Copilot settings.

### Learn more

To explore all models available in GitHub Copilot, see [our documentation on available models](https://docs.github.com/copilot/reference/ai-models/supported-models?utm_source=model-release-announcement&utm_medium=changelog&utm_campaign=newmodels) and get started with Copilot.

### Share your feedback

Join the [GitHub Community](https://docs.github.com/copilot/reference/ai-models/supported-models?utm_source=model-release-announcement&utm_medium=changelog&utm_campaign=newmodels) to share your feedback.
Title: Gemini 3.1 Pro is now in public preview in GitHub Copilot
Author: Kate Catlin
